intro: Convolvulus arvensis var. hastulatus, commonly known as the arrowleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and trumpet-shaped flowers. The flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom from late spring to early autumn. This plant thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, along roadsides, and in waste areas. It is known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
